designtools¶

Created on Wed Mar 6 16:46:04 2019

@author: yoelr

biosteam.units.designtools.vacuum_system(massflow:'kg/hr', volflow:'m3/hr', P_suction:'Pa', vol:'m3', vacuum_system_preference=None)[source]¶

Return dictionary of results

Parameters
massflowfloat

Vapor mass flow rate entering vacuum system from vessel (not including inleakage)

volflowfloat

Vapor volumetric flow rate entering vacuum system from vessel (not including inleakage)

P_suctionfloat

Suction pressure

volfloat

Vacuum volume

vacuum_system_preferencetuple[str] or str

Name(s) of preferred vacuum systems

Returns
float

power (kW)

float

cost (USD)

biosteam.units.designtools.GTable(DRho, Hlr)[source]¶

Return the allowable downflow (baffle liquid load) in gph/ft2, usually used for vertical vessel.

Parameters
DRhofloat

Density difference between light liquid and vapor (lb/ft^3 ?)

Hlrfloat

Height of liquid level above the interphase of light liquid and heavy liquid (ft)

biosteam.units.designtools.HNATable(Type, X)[source]¶

Table for cylindrical height and area conversions.

Parameters

Type: [int] 1 if given H/D and find A/At, 2 if given A/At and find H/D

X: [float] H/D or A/At

biosteam.units.designtools.FinalValue(value)[source]¶

Return value to the next/highest 0.5 units

biosteam.units.designtools.VesselWeightAndWallThickness(Pressure, Diameter, VesselLength, rho_M, Je=0.85)[source]¶

Return vessel weight and wall thickness.

Parameters

Pressure: [float] (psia)

Diameter: [float] (ft)

VesselLength: [float] (ft)

rho_M: [float] Density of Material (lb/ft^3)

Je: [float] Joint efficiency (1.0 for X-Rayed joints, 0.85 for thin carbon steel)

biosteam.units.designtools.Kvalue(P)[source]¶

Return K-constant in Stoke’s Law using the York-Demister equation.

Parameters

P: [float] Pressure (psia)

biosteam.units.designtools.size_batch(v_0, tau, tau_0, N_reactors, V_wf) → dict[source]¶

Solve for batch reactor volume, cycle time, and loading time

Parameters
v_0

Flow rate

tau

Reaction time

tau_0

Turnaround time

N_reactors

Number of reactors

V_wf

Fraction of working volume

Returns
dict[str: float]

  • ‘Reactor volume’

  • ‘Cycle time’

  • ‘Loading time’
